channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 abandoned vehicles a sliver Mercedes and a black fiesta park on the grass side of Regent Square, 17th October
item.description:
2 abandoned vehicles a sliver Mercedes and a black fiesta park on the grass side of Regent Square half way down. Both cars have been there for over 3 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent Square, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: RG Solicitors, 17th October
item.description:
Good Morning, We have a corner premises with shutters facing at two sides, one on Willesden Lane and other on Aldershot Road, We don't know if the graffiti is offensive but it certainly is very large and unpleasant.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Junction, 17th October
item.description:
The incoming cars from Woolwich road into Bedwell Road which is a One Way direction part, north to south, then joins the other bend part of two directions Bedwellroad, as in the photo. Most of the cars don’t stop, sometimes even don’t slow down at this junction. It is dangerous one. The solution, would be a Bollards in the shaded ares of the junction. Definitely a rectangular sign * STOP * should be erected there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedwell Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping fences on pathway, 17th October
item.description:
I reported this and followed it say investigating, actioned and then resolved but it wasn't resolved it's still there, I then reported it again but it still said investigating and now people have added to it and the school kids have started jumping all over it smashing it up, there are nails and screws and pointy brackets sticking out and as I said it's now where people walk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halcot Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, no tax, not MOT, 17th October
item.description:
This was reported to you, initially on 18th September, yet still has not been removed. WHY DOES THIS CAR REMAIN? Your site says that the orginally reported case is now closed. THIS IS NOT THE CASE AS THE "ABANDONED CAR" IS STILL THERE! FixMyStreet ref: 8181481.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlewood Drive, Shooters Hill, London
